featured.text: The theory underlying it is that lying is stressful, and that this stress can be measured and recorded on a polygraph machine.
However, because different people behave differently when lying, a polygraph test is by no means perfect.
Well-trained examiners can usually detect lying with a high degree of 25 when they use a polygraph.
When a person takes a polygraph test, four to six wires, called sensors, are 22 to different parts of his body.

definition.zh_def: 多項測謊器，一種用於測量和記錄生理反應的儀器，通常用於偵測謊言。
definition.en_def: A device that measures and records physiological responses, often used to detect lies.
definition.example: The detective used a polygraph to determine if the suspect was telling the truth.
